Detailed Description

The algorithm base class. A user algorithm must inherit from this class to implement its algorithm

Definition at line 280 of file LibAlgoSim.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Algorithm_base::Algorithm_base (  ) 

initialises registers and sets regsize to 16 and makes it listen for events.

Definition at line 6 of file algorithm_base.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

virtual state Algorithm_base::CreateCurrentState (  )  [pure virtual]

Used by algorithm_base class to generate the state object based on current set of values. This should be implemented by user algo and put the values of all registers into the state object

Returns:
the state object generated by current set of values

void Algorithm_base::CreateState (  ) 

This function is called by the user algo's algorithm class in StartMachine() function after the completion of each step

See also:
StartMachine()

Definition at line 17 of file algorithm_base.cpp.

virtual void Algorithm_base::processEvent ( const state &  ev  )  [pure virtual]

The pure virtual function for processing events of type state

virtual void Algorithm_base::ReInitialiseFromState ( state   )  [pure virtual]

This should be overridden by user algo. After completing a in-between-step oprations appmain uses this function to ask the machine to reinitialise it's registers from the given state.

Parameters:
s the state from which the user algo must initialise its registers

virtual void Algorithm_base::StartMachine (  )  [pure virtual]

Must be overridden by user algo. This is the main() of the algorithm. The working of the algorithm should be written in this function. CreateState() must be called after completion of each step.

See also:
CreateState()
